intro: Evolvulus glomeratus subsp. glomeratus, commonly known as the clusterleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and northern Mexico. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. The species is known for its rapid growth and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields.
